newsitem.title: USA: GOLF-VETERAN CADDIE UNDERGOES BONE MARROW TRANSPLANT.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-VETERAN CADDIE UNDERGOES BONE MARROW TRANSPLANT.

text.p: Well-known caddie Jeff "Squeeky" Medlen underwent a second bone narrow transplant on Thursday, Nick Price said Friday.

Price, who was leading the PGA Tour event here after two rounds, told reporters that Medlen had received his mother's bone marrow for the second time, after a first transplant three months ago proved unsuccessful.
"He didn't want to have it done at all (but) that is about the only thing that is going to save his life right now," Price said.
"It is the only option. He is sicker now than he has ever been. I went to see him the Sunday before Augusta and I hardly recognised him. It was very, very sad."
Medlen, 42, worked for Price for six years before quitting last November, four months after learning he had leukaemia.
He underwent the latest transplant at the Ohio State University Hospital in Columbus.
